intro: Tribonanthes purpurea, commonly known as the purple sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial with slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of purple to pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to xeriscapic gardens and native plant landscapes.
